post.description: Depending on your use case an Address can be used in many different ways. Certain carriers allow rating between two zip codes, but full addresses are required to purchase postage. It is recommended to provide as much information as possible during creation and to reuse these objects whenever possible.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Address objects are used to represent people, places, and organizations in a number of contexts. For example, a Shipment requires a to_address and from_address to accurately calculate rates and generate postage.

get.description: An Address can be retrieved by either its id or reference. However it is recommended to use EasyPost's provided identifiers because uniqueness on reference is not enforced.
Retrieve an unpaginated list of all CarrierAccounts available to the authenticated account. Only Production API keys may be used to retrieve this list, as there is no test mode equivalent.

post.description: CarrierAccount objects may be managed through the EasyPost API using the Production mode API key only. Multiple accounts can be added for a single carrier (with the exception of the USPS).

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: A CarrierAccount encapsulates your credentials with the carrier. The CarrierAccount object provides CRUD operations for all CarrierAccounts.

get.description: Retrieve an unpaginated list of all CarrierAccounts available to the authenticated account. Only Production API keys may be used to retrieve this list, as there is no test mode equivalent.

put.description: Updates can be made to description, reference, and any fields in credentials or test_credentials.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: A CarrierAccount encapsulates your credentials with the carrier. The CarrierAccount object provides CRUD operations for all CarrierAccounts.

delete.description: CarrierAccount objects may be removed from your account when they become out of date or no longer useful.

CreateAddressPayload.title: CreateAddressPayload

carrier_facility.description: The specific designation for the address (only relevant if the address is a carrier facility)

city.description: City the address is located in

company.description: Name of the organization. Both name and company can be included

country.description: ISO 3166 country code for the country the address is located in

email.description: Email to reach the person or organization

federal_tax_id.description: Federal tax identifier of the person or organization

mode.description: Set based on which api-key you used, either "test" or "production"

name.description: Name of the person. Both name and company can be included

phone.description: Phone number to reach the person or organization

residential.description: Whether or not this address would be considered residential

state.description: State or province the address is located in

state_tax_id.description: State tax identifier of the person or organization

zip.description: ZIP or postal code the address is located in

CreateAddressPayload.description: Address objects are used to represent people, places, and organizations in a number of contexts. For example, a Shipment requires a to_address and from_address to accurately calculate rates and generate postage.

CreateCarrierAccountPayload.title: CreateCarrierAccountPayload

clone.description: If clone is true, only the reference and description are possible to update

created_at.description: The name used when displaying a readable value for the type of the account

credentials.description: Unlike the "credentials" object contained in "fields", this nullable object contains just raw credential pairs for client library consumption

description.description: An optional, user-readable field to help distinguish accounts

readable.description: The name used when displaying a readable value for the type of the account

reference.description: An optional field that may be used in place of carrier_account_id in other API endpoints

test_credentials.description: Unlike the "test_credentials" object contained in "fields", this nullable object contains just raw test_credential pairs for client library consumption

type.description: The name of the carrier type. Note that "EndiciaAccount" is the current USPS integration account type

updated_at.description: The name used when displaying a readable value for the type of the account

CreateCarrierAccountPayload.description: A CarrierAccount encapsulates your credentials with the carrier. The CarrierAccount object provides CRUD operations for all CarrierAccounts.

carrier_facility.description: The specific designation for the address (only relevant if the address is a carrier facility)

city.description: City the address is located in
city.example: Blanditiis consectetur aut vero tempore quibusdam ullam.

company.description: Name of the organization. Both name and company can be included

country.description: ISO 3166 country code for the country the address is located in
country.example: Et sequi maiores voluptates sunt corporis ut.

email.description: Email to reach the person or organization

federal_tax_id.description: Federal tax identifier of the person or organization

mode.description: Set based on which api-key you used, either "test" or "production"
mode.example: Tenetur unde eveniet aliquam ut est.

name.description: Name of the person. Both name and company can be included
name.example: Quos vel qui quibusdam dolor est dicta.

phone.description: Phone number to reach the person or organization

residential.description: Whether or not this address would be considered residential

state.description: State or province the address is located in

state_tax_id.description: State tax identifier of the person or organization

street1.example: Sint nobis sed similique sequi corporis.

street2.example: Quisquam reiciendis sunt deserunt vel culpa veritatis.

zip.description: ZIP or postal code the address is located in

example.city: Blanditiis consectetur aut vero tempore quibusdam ullam.
example.country: Et sequi maiores voluptates sunt corporis ut.
example.mode: Tenetur unde eveniet aliquam ut est.
example.name: Quos vel qui quibusdam dolor est dicta.
example.street1: Sint nobis sed similique sequi corporis.
example.street2: Quisquam reiciendis sunt deserunt vel culpa veritatis.

credentials.description: Unlike the "credentials" object contained in "fields", this nullable object contains just raw credential pairs for client library consumption

description.description: An optional, user-readable field to help distinguish accounts

readable.description: The name used when displaying a readable value for the type of the account

reference.description: An optional field that may be used in place of carrier_account_id in other API endpoints

test_credentials.description: Unlike the "test_credentials" object contained in "fields", this nullable object contains just raw test_credential pairs for client library consumption

EasypostCarrier_types.title: Mediatype identifier: application/easypost.carrier_types+json

readable.description: The name used when displaying a readable value for the type of the account

type.description: The name of the carrier type. Note that "EndiciaAccount" is the current USPS integration account type

EasypostCarrier_types.description: The CarrierType object provides an interface for determining the valid fields of a CarrierAccount. The list of CarrierType objects only changes when a new carrier is added to EasyPost. (default view)

EasypostCarrier_typesCollection.title: Mediatype identifier: application/easypost.carrier_types+json; type=collection
EasypostCarrier_typesCollection.description: EasypostCarrier_typesCollection is the media type for an array of EasypostCarrier_types (default view)

EasypostFields_object.title: Mediatype identifier: application/easypost.fields_object+json

auto_link.description: For USPS this designates that no credentials are required.

credentials.description: Credentials used in the production environment.

custom_workflow.description: When present, a seperate authentication process will be required through the UI to link this account type.

test_credentials.description: Credentials used in the test environment.

EasypostFields_object.description: Contains "credentials" and/or "test_credentials", or may be empty (default view)
